name: Premier Inn Norwich Nelson City Centre

reviews.text: The Premier Inn is located just across the road from Norwich Station which makes it convenient for staying in the City. It is very clean and the rooms have everything you need. Unfortunately at busy times it can take ages to get booked-in upon arrival. The Hotel has a very nice bar and restaurant. The self-service breakfast was good. The Hotel overlooks the river and the Car Park is free whilst staying there. I would recommend this Hotel.
reviews.title: Good Hotel - Excellent Location

reviews.text: Comfortable room and good breakfast. Checking in was a bit laborious because we arrived on a Football match evening. It has it's own free car park which is a bonus in the centre of Norwich. The surrounding area is a bit lively in the evenings (pubs and clubs) so you may wish to take this into account when booking.
reviews.title: Quite reasonable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night at the bargain price of £29 per room , Location excellent - room overlooked the river, walking distance from town centre and cathedral. Bed very comfortable bathroom clean and spacious, staff pleasant and helpful , would certainly return.
reviews.title: bargain priced quality

reviews.text: I've stayed at quite a few hotels in Norwich, but this was the best experience. With all the happening pubs & eateries nearby, its the most approachable & comfortable bed to retire into, after a fun tiring party, or also after a good day of work. I spent most of the time, sitting out in the balcony, by the riverside, enjoying the view, with ducks making the surroundings seem so serene. Rooms are large with huge comfortable mattresses. Wifi speed is good , priced a little on the higher side, but if company paid, then hardly matters.
reviews.title: Refreshing Riverside View from Balcony

reviews.text: Restaurant is good to take clients too. Breakfast is excellent.
reviews.title: nice position near waterfront,but expensive WIFI

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As others have said, follow signs for the station and you will have no trouble negotiating your way to the hotel. The car park is around the back with a barrier. Just take a ticket and get it validated by the hotel on leaving and the parking is free. A great bonus in Norwich.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was easy. We asked for a room overlooking the river and got it. It might have been noisy being over the Table Table and near to the bridge, but the double glazing solved that problem. The room was simple, but clean with fluffy white towels, hair drier and tea and coffee - but only just enough to make a brew. We had been given a 'good night sleep' guarantee, and it was no fault of the fluffy pillows and bed that I didn't achieve that. The bed was comfy, but I suffer from labrynthitis and the water-bed effect caused me some dizziness - and no, it wasn't the bargain wine on offer in Table Table!! We ate in there the two nights. The menu is staple pub grub. They do it well and the service is excellent from friendly young staff who seem very customer focused.
reviews.title: Unbeatable breakfast for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is directly opposite the station, in a very convenient location. It is good value for money and provides good service. The attractions of Norwich are within easy walking distance. Definitely recommended.
reviews.title: Great rooms, staff and location.

reviews.text: We stay at this hotel fairly regularly because the location is so convenient when we visit family and friends. It is just across the road from the train station (though we always travel by car), close to the city's nightlife, with a good choice of restaurants nearby, and within easy walking distance of the city centre and Norwich City football ground. If you are lucky enough to get a room overlooking the river it's a lovely bonus.
reviews.title: We stayed 3 nights here as we had a...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is plenty of free car parking space.
reviews.title: Does the trick

reviews.text: The hotel looked as if it had recently been redecorated. I was really surprised with the cleanliness and quality of the room and bathroom. The only thing missing was an iron and ironing board. Breakfast was typical for this type of hotel.
reviews.title: Surprisingly good

reviews.text: You have to ask about parking yourself
reviews.title: payed out 31.50 for parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: NO ADVICE
reviews.title: A very nice surprise

reviews.text: Asked for car registration but not explained payment
reviews.title: Excellent Location and Good Value for Money

reviews.text: Advert on site post was pay at machine found at entrance as payment not exsepted at barrier
reviews.title: Great location and good value for money

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel 3 or 4 times since it became a Premier Inn and I always enjoy my stay. Location is great, parking is free and the rooms are really spacious. Really like the in-house pub/restaurant as well as they sell reasonably priced food and it's nice not to have to leave the hotel for a pint. I will definitely be staying here again but there a couple of points I noticed on my last trip that weren't so good:
reviews.title: Reliably good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - We arrived early and knew we couldn't check in but wanted to let them know the car was in the car park. Only 1 receptionist was on duty and the second eventually emerged with her handbag from the customer toilet. We waited a long time for a simple conversation which was a bit irritating (and I really hate it when staff use customer facilities but that is being very picky!);
reviews.title: Location and Good Value

reviews.text: - My sister had to ask three times at breakfast for vegetarian sausages and they were cold when they arrived. There was a general scrum around the toast area and very few staff so didn't complain but I think this hotel can do better than that.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from that I really like this hotel and will be returning for our annual shopping trip in December.
reviews.title: Consistently good

reviews.text: Friendly and professional welcome by the well trained receptionist (thank you Dani).
reviews.title: Very happy with brief stay

aka: Premier Inn Norwich Nelson City Centre Hotel Norwich
